feed.title: NewsTracker: cyclone
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: UN appeals for nearly $20 million for victims of Cyclone Pam which devastated Vanuatu
UN appeals for $20 million for Vanuatu cyclone victims
entry.summary:
The cyclone's winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour devastated much of the archipelago on March 13, killing 17 people and leaving about 65,000 homeless.

A U.N. appeal for about $30 million was launched on March 24 to cover the needs of 166,000 cyclone-affected people for three months but Dujarric said that to date donors have given only $10.7 million, just 36 per cent.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan hits the Northern Territory
entry.summary: The cyclone has been lashing the NT with wind gusts reaching up to 140km/h in some areas.

entry.title: Coney Island Cyclone gets stuck during inaugural run on opening day
Coney Island roller coaster mishap briefly strands riders
entry.summary: Witnesses tell the Daily News (http://nydn.us/1IbCmov ) about 24 passengers on the first run of the Cyclone at Luna Park on Sunday were readying for the initial drop when it suddenly stopped.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Is it time for a category-6 cyclone rating?
entry.summary:
Cyclone Pam left debris scattered across Port Vila with residents now beginning the massive clean-up effort.

Jonathan Nott, a professor at James Cook University and expert on cyclone history, said there has "been a lot of discussion over the last five to 10 years" about the need to extend the cyclone severity rating beyond the current maximum of five.

According to the New Zealand's MetService, satellites indicate Cyclone Pam reached mean wind speeds of 270 km/h, with gusts even higher as it passed over the Pacific island nation.

In the case of Cyclone Pam, Professor Nott said the worst of the storm missed Port Vila, with islands to the south, such as Erromango, likely to have received a direct hit.

Cyclone Pam was "certainly one of the biggest storms to occur in the South Pacific", Kevin Walsh, an associate professor at Melbourne University, said.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary:
All 427 of the island's residents were flown to Darwin for four days in February as category 4 Cyclone Lam bore down, and again for two days this week as category 2 Cyclone Nathan approached, which was forecast to intensify to a category 3.

"It's just a community that's never had a cyclone shelter and never had a coded building which can accommodate the 400-odd resident population," he told the ABC.

entry.title: Ex-cyclone to cause wild weather in NT
entry.summary: Early on Wednesday morning, the Bureau of Meteorology warned of damaging winds and heavy rain in the Arnhem and Daly districts as the ex-cyclone moved west.

entry.title: U.N. targets shelter, water in $29.9 million appeal for cyclone-hit Vanuatu
Cyclone crosses remote Australian coast near evacuated island
After Cyclone Pam, Vanuatu revives, rebuilds and rethinks
entry.summary: In this Saturday, March 21, 2015, a police vehicle drives over a bridge as it is repaired after it was damaged by Cyclone Pam, on the island of Efate, Vanuatu.

entry.title: After Cyclone Pam, Vanuatu revives, rebuilds and rethinks
entry.summary: In this Saturday, March 21, 2015 photo, residents pass the time on a catamaran that was washed ashore during Cyclone Pam in Port Vila, Vanuatu.

entry.title: Cyclone on course to smash into Australian coast a second time
entry.summary: In February, Cyclone Lam smashed near the same coastline, displacing about 200 people and destroying some 50 homes.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan to intensify off NT coast
entry.summary:
It's the second time in one month that the island has been emptied, since Cyclone Lam hit the Northern Territory on February 20, because there is no confidence that any buildings on the island could withstand a category 3 storm.

A cyclone warning covers Cape Don to Milingimbi, including Croker Island, Goulburn Island, Gunbalanya, Jabiru and Maningrida, and residents are warned to proceed immediately to shelters if their homes are not safe.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan affecting Elcho Island
entry.summary:
Elcho Island was severely damaged by Cyclone Law in late February, and a storm tide, with damaging waves and dangerous flooding, was also expected between Elcho Island and Cape Shield.

Earlier, the Bureau said Nathan would remain a category three cyclone into the latter part of Monday, then hopefully weaken to a category one or two system before making landfall again around Tuesday.

entry.title: After Vanuatu was hit by Cyclone Pam, one man ate finches and bats
entry.summary: "Prime Minister I want to assure you that the Australian government and the Australian people will continue to support you in your time of need, not only in the immediate aftermath of the cyclone, but I know that your long term recovery efforts will take some time."

entry.title: Foreign Minister Julie Bishop vows continuing support in Vanuatu after Cyclone Pam
Julie Bishop lands in Vanuatu to support Cyclone Pam recovery effort
entry.summary: She will meet Australian government staff and volunteers working in Vanuatu as part of the immediate cyclone response.

entry.title: NT residents warned to 'take shelter now' from Cyclone Nathan
entry.summary: It was moving northwest over Arnhem Bay, west of Nhulunbuy, at 13km/h on Sunday with the destructive core approaching Elcho Island, which was severely damaged by Cyclone Law in late February.

entry.title: NT residents warned to 'take shelter now' from Cyclone Nathan
entry.summary:
The cyclone, which has intensified to a "high end" category 2, crossed the coast between Nhulunbuy and Cape Shield on Sunday morning.

It's west of Nhulunbuy, moving northwest at 14km/h over the Gove Peninsula towards Elcho Island, which was severely damaged by Cyclone Lam in late February.

entry.title: Nathan hitting NT as category two cyclone
Vanuatu residents begin to rebuild after Cyclone Pam
entry.summary: Around 65,000 people across Vanuatu are in need of temporary emergency shelter, according to the U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs, which raised the death toll from the cyclone to 16 on Saturday, after confirming three more casualties.

entry.title: After Cyclone Pam, Vanuatu's people revive, rebuild and, in some cases, rethink
entry.summary:
And she's running low on the rice she had before Cyclone Pam tore through Vanuatu a week ago, upending her life.

A week after the cyclone tore through the South Pacific archipelago with winds of 270 kilometers (168 miles) per hour, people are focused on the task of rebuilding.

entry.title: Half of Vanuatu's population affected by Cyclone Pam: UN
entry.summary: "Around 166,000 people, more than half of Vanuatu's population, have been affected by Tropical Cyclone Pam on 22 islands," the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said in a situation report.

entry.title: 5 Things to Know About Vanuatu's Devastating Cyclone
entry.summary: It has been a week since Cyclone Pam ravaged the tiny South Pacific island nation of Vanuatu, killing at least 13 people and leaving thousands homeless, hungry and desperate for help.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: Cyclone Pam transformed much of Vanuatu from a tropical green to a dirty brown overnight, as coconut trees were stripped of their foliage and snapped like matchsticks and even some mighty banyan trees were toppled.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary:
People living on hard-hit Tanna and many of the other islands may have survived the cyclone, but they have no way of knowing how their relatives or friends are faring elsewhere.

Aid agencies, many of which were active in Vanuatu before the cyclone, have arrived in sometimes overwhelming numbers.

entry.title: 5 things to know about Vanuatu's devastating cyclone
entry.summary: The cyclone has knocked down fruit-bearing trees and destroyed crops across the country.

entry.title: A week after Vanuatu cyclone, some homeless still await help
entry.summary:
The group were among more than 800 people who took shelter from Cyclone Pam in Freswota School, in the capital Port Vila.

"After the cyclone, about a week now, we haven't received any urgent relief from the government or any NGOs or any other departments," said Charlie Nirua, who lost his family home in the storm.

The school is run by husband and wife team Regina and Manses Kalo, who say it was a nominated evacuation center and that Save the Children were first on the scene after the cyclone churned across the island.

entry.title: A week after Vanuatu cyclone, some homeless still await help
entry.summary: "People came in on the evening of the cyclone with their own food, water and whatever they need for the night of the cyclone," Regina said.

entry.title: In Vanuatu, survivors await help as death toll inches up
entry.summary: The cyclone had also ruined the students' supplies.

entry.title: Thousands wait for relief in cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu as death toll climbs to 13
Thousands wait for relief in Vanuatu as death toll inches up
entry.summary: Joseph Kamisak, tourism minister for the island's Eastern Province, said many water pipes were broken and the water systems were filled with wood and debris from the cyclone.

entry.title: Thousands wait for relief in Vanuatu as death toll inches up
entry.summary: The cyclone wiped out gardens, killed livestock and contaminated the water supply in many areas, and agricultural experts estimate that those displaced by the storm will run out of food in less than a week.

entry.title: Australian cyclone makes landfall, loses strength
Cyclone Nathan makes landfall in Australia, losses strength
entry.summary: Cyclone Nathan made landfall shortly before dawn as a category four system, the second highest intensity rating, and was expected to continue its westward movement inland while weakening, according to Australia's Bureau of Meteorology.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan makes landfall in Australia, losses strength
entry.summary: The cyclone is expected to lose much of its punch over land, but meteorologists warned it could reform again if it reaches the warm waters of the Gulf of Carpentaria, 250 km (155 miles) from the coast.

entry.title: Cooktown spared as Cyclone Nathan hits
entry.summary: A cyclone warning remains from Cape Sidmouth to Cape Melville, including inland areas, and a watch alert is in place for areas between Numbulwar and Maningrida in the NT.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan lashes far north Qld coast
entry.summary:
Category one Cyclone Nathan is expected to turn into a low in the Gulf of Carpentaria off western Cape York in the early hours of Saturday.

Cyclone Nathan was about 55km south-southwest of Coen on Cape York on Friday evening.

Dozens spent Thursday night bunkered down in cyclone shelters at Cooktown and Hope Vale.

Mayor Peter Scott said authorities and residents were well prepared for the storm after being smashed by category four Cyclone Ita in April last year.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan crossing Qld coast
entry.summary:
The cyclone made landfall between Cape Melville and Cape Flattery at about 4am (AEST).

The very destructive core of the cyclone, which is packing wind gusts of up to 230km/h, is moving slightly further north than what was expected.

Heavy rainfall that could cause flash flooding is also occurring in coastal and adjacent inland between Coen and Cape Tribulation, and will extend west across Cape York Peninsula with the passage of the cyclone.

entry.title: Cyclone Nathan crossing Qld coast
Cyclone Pam rips through Vanuatu's Manua school
entry.summary: "Every time when the cyclone was heaving the roof up we had to [pull on the ropes], I was the captain and would call out "pull!" and everyone would hang on to the rope, even the little kids who were still awake. We stopped them from sleeping because it's not safe."

entry.title: Vanuatu provides lessons in cyclone survival
Cyclone survivors desperate for aid
entry.summary:
With power, phones and Internet still down across much of the country, officials faced logistical headaches in sorting out where to send supplies, particularly in Tanna Island, which was hit hard by Cyclone Pam's 168mph winds.

Many locals rode out the cyclone in larger buildings such as schools and churches - a practice that relief groups have impressed upon Vanuatuans as a life-saving measure during storms.

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef braces for cyclone hit
entry.summary:
A month ago, Cyclone Marcia slammed into the southern part of the same coast, causing billions of dollars in damage and leaving thousands homeless or without electricity.

Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said up to 9,000 people could be directly in the path of the cyclone by the time it builds to category four strength, the second highest level.

entry.title: Great Barrier Reef region braces for Cyclone Nathan
Vanuatu after Cyclone Pam: Risk of hunger and disease rises
Cyclone Pam: At least eight Australians missing in Vanuatu
entry.summary: Eight Australians are among 19 volunteer teachers missing in Vanuatu, five days after Cyclone Pam tore through the Pacific nation.

entry.title: Fears of food, water shortages persist as relief groups rush aid to Vanuatu
entry.summary:
Planes carried food, water and medical supplies to hard-hit Tanna Island, where aerial assessments showed more than 80 per cent of homes or buildings had been partially or completely destroyed by Cyclone Pam.

On Tanna, the cyclone's fierce winds uprooted water tanks and blew them kilometres away, said Hohenboken from Oxfam, who travelled to the island.

entry.title: Relief groups rush to deliver aid to Vanuatu?s cyclone-hit islands
Round-world fleet sails again as cyclone subsides
entry.summary: Skippers and organisers agreed to hold up the start of the 6,776-nautical mile stage to allow the cyclone to clear the fleet's planned route up New Zealand's north island coast.

entry.title: Volvo Ocean Race boats depart Auckland after cyclone delay
Food concerns mount in Vanuatu after monster cyclone
Pacific nations to highlight Cyclone Pam in climate change talks
entry.summary:
The presidents of Vanuatu and Kiribati both drew a clear link between global warming and the cyclone.

"There is low confidence that long-term changes in tropical cyclone activity are robust, and there is low confidence in the attribution of global changes to any particular cause," it said.

entry.title: Vanuatu's Tanna island residents are running out of food after Cyclone Pam
entry.summary: Food has become scarce after Cyclone Pam flattened the southern Vanuatu island Tanna.

entry.title: Relief teams reach Vanuatu's cyclone-hit outer islands
entry.summary: Adrian Banga surveys his destroyed house in Port Vila, Vanuatu in the aftermath of Cyclone Pam, Monday, March 16, 2015.

entry.title: Relief teams reach Vanuatu's cyclone-hit outer islands
entry.summary: In this March 15, 2015 photo provided by UNICEF Pacific, a man works to recover from Cyclone Pam in Mele village, on the outskirts of the capital Port Vila, Vanuatu.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam lifts chance of El Nino this year in Australia, forecasters says
entry.summary:
Cyclone Pam's impact may not be restricted to devastating the island nation of Vanuatu - it may also have boosted the likelihood of an El Nino event for later this year, the Bureau of Meteorology said.

The chances of an El Nino have "had a real kick along" from Cyclone Pam, said Andrew Watkins, manager of climate prediction services at the bureau.

entry.title: Death toll reaches 11 in Vanuatu, where Cyclone Pam damage limits rescuer access
entry.summary: Residents of cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu hunkered in emergency shelters for a second straight night Saturday after venturing out to find their homes damaged or blown away by the powerful storm, aid workers said.

entry.title: Rescue teams reach cyclone stricken Vanuatu islands, official toll lowered
entry.summary: Relief workers were still battling to reach many of the islands pummeled by Cyclone Pam's gusts of more than 300 kph (185 mph) on Friday and Saturday.

entry.title: Aid agencies to begin helicopter flights to cyclone-stricken Vanuatu
entry.summary: A boy named Samuel kicks a ball as his father Phillip searches through the ruins of their home which was destroyed by Cyclone Pam in Port Vila, Vanuatu March 16, 2015.

entry.title: Vanuatu president: Cyclone Pam was 'a monster'
entry.summary: A boy plays in a banana plantation destroyed by Cyclone Pam on March 19 in Mele, Vanuatu.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Is it time for a category-6 cyclone rating?
entry.summary:
The unusual strength of Cyclone Pam, which devastated Vanuatu over the weekend, may stir debate about the need for a category-6 rating for storms to reflect their increasing severity.

Based on the differences between category-3 and -4 cyclones, a category-6 cyclone would signal mean wind speeds of about 240 km/h or stronger, with a central pressure of less than 915 hPa.

entry.title: Vanuatu president says nation must start anew after cyclone
entry.summary:
Lonsdale was interviewed in Sendai, in northeastern Japan, where he had been attending a U.N. disaster conference when the cyclone struck.

New Zealand radio journalist Frances Cook and her husband traveled to Vanuatu for their honeymoon two days before the cyclone struck.

entry.title: Cyclone-ravaged Vanuatu struggles to determine scale of damage, deaths as aid starts flowing
entry.summary: Radio and telephone communications with the outer islands were just beginning to be restored, but remained patchy four days after Cyclone Pam tore through the islands.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam strikes Vanuatu, killing at least six and damaging 90 per cent of buildings in the capital
entry.summary:
Looking weary and red-eyed, Baldwin Lonsdale said in an interview Monday with The Associated Press that the latest information he has is that six people are confirmed dead and 30 injured from Cyclone Pam.

Officials in Vanuatu had still not made contact with outlying islands and were struggling to determine the scale of devastation from the cyclone, which tore through early Saturday, packing winds of 270 kilometres per hour.

entry.title: Vanuatu president, heading home from Japan disaster conference, rues devastation from cyclone
entry.summary: A: "Cyclone Pam has devastated Port Vila. More than 90 percent of the buildings and houses in Port Vila have been destroyed or damaged. The state of emergency that has been issued is only for Port Vila. Once we receive an update on the extent of the damage in the provinces then another state of emergency will be issued for the outer islands."

entry.title: Vanuatu president speaks of devastation from Cyclone Pam
entry.summary: A: "This is a very devastating cyclone in Vanuatu. I term it as a monster, a monster. It's a setback for the government and for the people of Vanuatu. After all the development that has taken place, all this development has been wiped out. So it means we will have to start anew again."

entry.title: Cyclone Pam's aftermath in Vanuatu ? in pictures
Aid teams report devastation and death after Vanuatu cyclone
Cyclone Pam: Australia gives Vanuatu $5 million in aid
entry.summary: Cyclone Pam left a trail of devastation across the Pacific island nation on Saturday, with 250 km/h winds levelling entire villages in the capital, Port Vila.

entry.title: Vanuatu struggles to account for cyclone damage, deaths
entry.summary: Scientists say it's impossible to attribute single weather events like Cyclone Pam to climate change.

entry.title: Vanuatu struggles to account for cyclone damage, deaths
President of cyclone-hit Vanuatu urges global action on disasters
entry.summary:
The president said he feared the impact from the tropical cyclone would be "the very, very, very worst" in isolated outer islands but damage was still being assessed.

The country's climate change minister, James Bule, said people in Vanuatu were aware of what to do when warned about the cyclone because they are used to dealing with storms, albeit of a lower strength.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: 'It was like a velociraptor', as Australians survive Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary:
They face long queues, piles of debris and patchy phone reception - but two Australian television producers are thankful they survived Tropical Cyclone Pam in one piece.

While the worst of the storm lasted for just twelve hours, the cyclone has left a lasting mark on the people and infrastructure of Vanuatu, Mr Ang told Fairfax Media while he queued for petrol on the Kumul Highway.

"Because there's only one ring road around the island of Efate, that was - and is - the only way to get you out of the north of the Island into town, into Port Vila. During the cyclone, that was ripped up and washed away. So we had to swim across that this afternoon to get to my friend's car," Ang said.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Vanuatu residents collect corpses in wake of monster storm
entry.summary:
Residents attempt to clean up after Cyclone Pam hit and talk about the night the cyclone hit.

These were some of the scenes that greeted dazed Vanuatu residents and tourists on Sunday as the rescue effort and clean-up started in the tiny Pacific island nation which was devastated by Cyclone Pam.

This image shows Cyclone Pam north of New Zealand at 6pm, local time, on Sunday.

Thousands more are believed to be homeless across some of the country's 83 islands after the cyclone's 300km/h gusts were reported to have leveled entire villages.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Vanuatu residents collect corpses in wake of monster storm
entry.summary: The monster category-5 storm, which brought wind gusts of 300km/h, has weakened to a category-3 cyclone as it heads towards New Zealand's North Island.

entry.title: ?Aid workers: At least 8 people dead in Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary:
For anybody who wasn't in a secure shelter during the cyclone "it would have been a very, very tough time for them," she said.

UNICEF estimated that 54,000 children were among those affected by the cyclone.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Aid flights arrive in storm-ravaged Vanuatu
entry.summary: Authorities in New Zealand are preparing for Cyclone Pam, which was forecast to pass north of the country on Sunday and Monday.

entry.title: Aid workers say 8 people confirmed dead in Vanuatu cyclone
entry.summary: "People are really upset and it's really hard, just because for the last couple of years, we haven't received a really big cyclone like this one," said Isso Nihmei, Vanuatu coordinator for the environmental and crisis response group 350.

entry.title: Vanuatu cyclone 'hit like a bomb'
entry.summary: The huge tropical cyclone smashed into Vanuatu in the South Pacific, terrifying residents and leaving "complete devastation" with fears on March 14 that dozens of people may have died.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam death toll to 'increase significantly' in Vanuatu
entry.summary:
A Nasa satellite image of cyclone Pam as the eye of the storm passes just east of Vanuatu.

"It's an absolutely devastating sight. We're seeing whole buildings and structures blown away. And those were large buildings - the smaller structures people are living in just didn't have a chance in category five cyclone.

They would have been picked up "like confetti" by the winds, Ms Morrison said, as the cyclone ravaged the islands from Friday night to Saturday morning.

entry.title: Aid workers say 8 people confirmed dead in Vanuatu cyclone
Dozens feared killed in Vanuatu by 'catastrophic' Cyclone Pam
Dozens feared killed in Vanuatu by 'catastrophic' Cyclone Pam
entry.summary:
The UN had unconfirmed reports of 44 people killed in one province, and said late on Saturday there was no clear number of deaths or injuries but the impact of the cyclone had been "catastrophic".

Fiji Weather Service meteorologist Neville Koop said the cyclone was weakening as it slowly moved away from Vanuatu, and would pass between Fiji and New Caledonia before brushing the North Island of New Zealand on Monday.

entry.title: Dozens feared killed in Vanuatu by 'catastrophic' Cyclone Pam
entry.summary: The full extent of the damage is unknown, with limited communications in place after Super Cyclone Pam, a maximum category five storm, slammed into the island nation late on Friday with gusts up to 320km/h.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves trail of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary: Packing winds of 168 miles per hour, Cyclone Pam tore through the tiny South Pacific archipelago early Saturday, leaving a trail of destruction and unconfirmed reports of dozens of deaths.

entry.title: Vanuatu president in cyclone appeal
entry.summary: Unicef spokeswoman Alice Clements described the cyclone as "15-30 minutes of absolute terror" as it passed over Port Vila.

entry.title: Dozens feared dead as cyclone pounds Pacific island of Vanuatu
entry.summary: Care International's Charlie Damon added: "Homes have been blown to pieces, and even evacuation shelters, where people had sought refuge, have been flooded and left exposed to Cyclone Pam.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Dozens feared dead in Vanuatu
entry.summary: Overnight Cyclone Pam charted a southward path of destruction, passing through several of the country's 83 islands, including the capital, Port Vila, on the island of Efate.

entry.title: UN head urges better help, safeguards for climate-related disasters as cyclone slams Vanuatu
entry.summary: "I am speaking to you today with a heart that is so heavy. I do not really know what impact the cyclone has had on Vanuatu," Vanuatu's president, Baldwin Lonsdale, told the U.N. World Conference on Disaster Risk Reduction in the northeastern Japanese city of Sendai.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves trail of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary: Communication systems in many of the hard-hit outer islands remained down, meaning it could take some time before the full extent of the damage caused by Cyclone Pam is known.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves swath of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
entry.summary: WELLINGTON, New Zealand -- Winds from an extremely powerful cyclone that blew through the Pacific's Vanuatu archipelago were beginning to subside Saturday, revealing widespread destruction and unconfirmed reports of dozens of deaths.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam leaves trail of destruction in Pacific's Vanuatu
Cyclone leaves trail of destruction
entry.summary:
UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said the impact and scope of the disaster caused by the cyclone was not yet clear, but he feared the damage and destruction could be widespread.

The president of Vanuatu, Baldwin Lonsdale, who was attending the conference, told participants: "I do not really know what impact the cyclone has had on Vanuatu.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam hits small Pacific nation of Vanuatu
Cyclone Pam: Dozens feared dead in Vanuatu
entry.summary: A westward change of course put populated areas directly in the path of Cyclone Pam's 270 kilometer (168 mile) -per-hour winds.

entry.title: NZ should prepare as Cyclone Pam deepens
entry.summary: Communications were knocked out in much of the region by Cyclone Pam, a maximum category five storm, and aid agencies said it could be several hours before a clear picture emerged.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam hits Vanuatu: More than 200,000 people at risk from category 5 tropical storm
entry.summary: A satellite image obtained from NASA shows Tropical Cyclone Pam hitting Vanuatu on Friday.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam hits Vanuatu: More than 200,000 people at risk from category 5 tropical storm
entry.summary:
Cyclone Pam has caused major damage to homes and buildings in Kiribati and Vanuatu.

About one sixth of the population live in the capital Port Vila, which suffered flooding and power cuts on Friday as the cyclone started to bear down on the town.

entry.title: Small Pacific Nation of Vanuatu hit by powerful cyclone PAM
entry.summary: The Category 5 cyclone had average wind speeds of 250 kph to 270 kph, with gusts up to 340 kph, according to the office.

entry.title: Cyclone Pam: Huge storm heading for tiny South Pacific island of Vanuatu
entry.summary: "As far as I can remember, this is the first [category five] cyclone to come very close to Vanuatu," he said.

entry.title: Huge cyclone bears down on tiny nation of Vanuatu
entry.summary:
The U.N. Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said in a release there were unconfirmed reports of deaths in Vanuatu's northeastern islands after Cyclone Pam moved off its expected track.

Authorities said they feared the cyclone would destroy homes as well as cause landslides and severe coastal flooding.

The cyclone has already destroyed some homes and caused damage to other Pacific islands including Kiribati and the Solomon Islands.

entry.title: Residents Seek Shelter as Cyclone Pam Bears Down on Vanuatu
Marcia unleashes her fury: Roofs ripped off homes, residents trapped in lifts and thousands left in darkness as Cyclone Marcia bears down on Queensland with 300km/h winds
entry.summary: The people of Ramingining were already out and about checking on cyclone damage to their homes despite warnings that Cyclone Lam was not over yet.

entry.title: ?Cyclone sandwich? leaves behind path of destruction in Australia
entry.summary:
In the Northern Territory, Cyclone Lam struck a remote stretch of coast, tearing up trees and downing power lines, but causing no widespread damage as it fizzled out and moved inland.

But a change in the cyclone's path spared them from the most ferocious winds, and it weakened as it headed south towards the city of Rockhampton, home to about 80,000 people.

entry.title: Cyclone Marcia: Climate change is expanding the tropics
entry.summary:
While south-east Queensland and northern NSW have been hit by big storms in the past - including the "Great Gold Coast Cyclone" of February 1954 - it is likely such events were "hybrids or intense east coast lows" rather than cyclones, he said.

Kevin Walsh, a cyclone expert at the University of Melbourne agreed that Cyclone Marcia was an abnormal storm.

Other big storms included a cyclone "very close to category 5" near Mackay in 1918 and Cyclone Dinah, a category 4 storm that stayed mostly offshore, Professor Walsh said.

The Bureau of Meteorology said the near-simultaneous landing of Cyclone Lam on the Northern Territory coast and Cyclone Marcia is the first recorded instance of twin severe cyclone events.

entry.title: Cyclone Marcia: Climate change is expanding the tropics
entry.summary:
Waves crash into a breakwall after Tropical Cyclone Marcia made landfall near Yeppoon.

Queensland residents and authorities are rushing to prepare as Cyclone Marcia intensifies and makes her presence felt.

"It's pretty unusual for a category 5 cyclone to strike the coast of Queensland this far south," Associate Professor Walsh said.
